Today, I led a guest lecture for the Southern Management Leadership Program students at @MontgomeryColl to speak about my experience in business, entrepreneurship, and what lead to my life in public service. It was a great opportunity to connect with these bright students.

Millions of families are facing eviction due to the COVID-19 pandemic. We need #RentReliefNow. I'm joining @RepMaxineWaters, @RepDennyHeck, & @SenSherrodBrown in supporting the Emergency Rental Assistance and Rental Market Stabilization Act to help keep families in their homes.

I'm greatly worried about the mental health of Americans this morning. For every one point increase in unemployment, the suicide rate trends up by .78%.

Today we learned the unemployment rate went up by 10.3% in April.

During this crisis, so many have gone above and beyond to help their communities. These heroes deserve recognition. That’s why I’m proud to announce our Team Maryland: Community Champions campaign, highlighting the heroes of the COVID-19 pandemic.

During #NationalNursesWeek, we celebrate our health care professionals on the frontlines of this crisis working tirelessly to save lives and protect the public. They are among the heroes of this crisis and we couldn't be more grateful. https://t.co/qVT8AFGJam

I just spoke with the CEO of Maryland Food Banks about how our food banks are being impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. Our state’s food banks are feeling the financial burden of this crisis all while experiencing an increase in demand.

This crisis has been disastrous for our students, leaving many of them behind. Today I spoke with the Board of @NEAToday to discuss how investing in high-speed broadband and mental health resources will help our students continue their studies from home.

Today, we must honor their sacrifice by remembering our role in the fight for equality for all. https://t.co/MLHxekvidr

99% of businesses in the nation are small businesses, and they are the cornerstone of our communities. During #NationalSmallBusinessWeek, we must recommit ourselves to ensuring that our small business communities get the resources and support they need to keep their doors open.
Thank you to our hard-working @SEIULocal500 members for keeping our children fed during this unprecedented crisis. https://t.co/DrLjGIM16E

On #HealthCareHeroesDay, we take time to honor our doctors, nurses, and all first responders working to keep us safe during this crisis. Thank you to these incredible workers in Maryland and across the country.

Last year, Montgomery County came together to mourn the loss of police officer TJ Bomba to suicide. This tremendous loss struck many in our community and brought attention to the mental and behavioral health needs of our first responders. #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth

This month, I’m celebrating Jewish Heritage Month. During this month, we recognize the strength and perseverance of our Jewish community in Maryland and across the country and continue to denounce hate and antisemitism wherever it exists.

This May, we come together to celebrate AAPI Heritage Month and recognize the contributions of our AAPI community in fighting the COVID-19 outbreak. As our nation continues to grapple with this crisis, we must recommit to fighting discrimination and hate in all forms.

As we celebrate #MentalHealthMonth, it's important to remember that the impacts of the #COVID19 pandemic are not just physical. Visit the CDC's guide to Stress and Coping for tips on how to manage this crisis. https://t.co/90xe94lHk5 https://t.co/bdTnrPtIwA

My #TeamMaryland colleagues and I just spoke to @MDHealthDept and @MDMEMA officials to learn about the status of testing and what the federal government can do to help increase our state's testing capacity. The more tests we conduct, the faster we can contain this pandemic.

Stimulating growth in Western Maryland couldn’t be more critical, especially as we endure the economic fallout caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. Today @SenatorCardin and I spoke with our Western Maryland economic leaders to hear about the hardships facing our business community.

My colleague @SenatorCardin and I spoke to our Western Maryland hospitals and health care system leaders to hear how the COVID-19 pandemic is impacting patients and staff. Our health facilities are in desperate need of high-speed broadband, PPE, and other necessary resources.

REMINDER: Join me and @SenatorCardin TODAY at 12 pm for my COVID-19 Nonprofit & Small Business Resource Webinar to learn the resources available to you and your organization. RSVP here: https://t.co/y7uDPVMrii https://t.co/EvGtgvDeyA

I had the chance to speak with Presidents from @FrederickCC, @AlleganyCollgMd, @GarrettCollege, and @MSMU to learn about the impacts the #COVID19 pandemic has had on students, faculty, and operations.

Our incarcerated populations are at high risk of #COVID19 infection. I spoke with Secretary Green of the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to discuss the agency's plans to protect incarcerated populations and correctional staff.

I spoke with Maryland labor leaders this morning about how the #COVID19 pandemic is impacting our workers. Each industry is being hit hard by this crisis, and I'm working with our federal, state, and local partners to ensure our workers get the PPE and paid leave they deserve.

In October, I participated in @BPC_Bipartisan's American Congressional Exchange program, where I visited @CathyMcMorris's district in Washington state and discussed how we can work together on issues like broadband.

Congratulations to @Mfume4Congress on winning the special election in Maryland's 7th Congressional district. I look forward to working together in the halls of Congress on issues facing all Marylanders.

Today we celebrate Yom Ha’atzmaut, Israel's Independence Day, and the 72nd anniversary of the establishment of the State of Israel. It's critical to strengthen our relationship with our vital ally and continue to promote peace and prosperity.

I'm excited to hear @BowieState and @UMESNews will be participating in the Federal Second Chance Pell Experiment, extending Pell Grants to incarcerated individuals. Access to higher education reduces recidivism rates and changes lives for the better.

On #WorkersMemorialDay, we mourn the working men and women we've lost as a result of their jobs. We must recommit to making our workplaces safer, especially as we endure this unprecedented crisis. https://t.co/Vzg4ymjZI4

On Thursday at 12:00 p.m, I'm hosting a Nonprofit & Small Business Resource Webinar with @SenatorCardin, the top Democrat on the Senate Committee on Small Business & Entrepreneurship, to discuss resources available to you and your organization. RSVP here: https://t.co/y7uDPVMrii https://t.co/eDmJ2jQ5pV

On the 105th anniversary of the Armenian Genocide, we remember the 1.5 million Armenians that perished during this tragedy. We will continue to honor the victims by speaking out against hate whenever we see it.

Yesterday, I hosted a tele-roundtable on school nutrition programs to hear what our public schools need to keep their students fed and their programs running. Programs are seeing a spike in demand as more families feel the financial strain of this crisis.
I just left Washington. While I was there, I was thinking of our frontline workers, our small business community, and all those that have been impacted by this crisis.

1 in 7 Maryland children is food insecure, and this will likely increase due to the #COVID19 pandemic. No child should go hungry, especially during a crisis. I'm supporting @RepKendraHorn's CARE for Kids Act, extending automatic eligibility for free school meals to kids in need.

Today, I joined my @HouseForeign colleagues for a briefing on COVID-19 global trends. We covered important topics including why we won't immediately see a vaccine and how U.S. leadership is pivotal during this global crisis. Global health = health and economic security at home.

I just spoke with the Presidents of @Hood_College, @UatShadyGrove, & @MontgomeryColl to hear how the #COVID19 pandemic has impacted students and faculty and how the government can help. These colleges have gone above and beyond to help their students during this difficult time.

We shouldn’t be shutting our doors to the doctors, researchers, entrepreneurs, & front line workers who are keeping our communities safe during this pandemic. The President should be focused on how we can get more testing to our states & how we can keep our communities healthy.
